title: How to Make a Pineapple Balloon

steps.headline: Blow up as many yellow balloons as you want pineapples.
steps.description: Tie a knot in the end of each balloon. Tie the string around the knot––you'll be hanging the balloon from this end.

steps.headline: On the green craft paper, draw long thin, sharp leaves.
steps.description: Draw the typical leaf shape of a pineapple. You'll need at least eight to ten of these leaves, proportioned to the size of the balloon.

steps.headline: Tape the leaves around the knot end of each balloon.
steps.description: Ensure that they are standing upright; sometimes this may require some creative taping.

steps.headline: Hang the balloon from the string length.
steps.description: The leaves face upward, the large round end of the balloon faces downward. Hang a row of pineapple balloons across a room for a fantastic tropical effect.

text: Blow up as many yellow balloons as you want pineapples. Tie a knot in the end of each balloon. Tie the string around the knot––you'll be hanging the balloon from this end. On the green craft paper, draw long thin, sharp leaves. Draw the typical leaf shape of a pineapple. You'll need at least eight to ten of these leaves, proportioned to the size of the balloon. Cut out the leaves. Cut as neatly as possible. Tape the leaves around the knot end of each balloon. Ensure that they are standing upright; sometimes this may require some creative taping. Hang the balloon from the string length. The leaves face upward, the large round end of the balloon faces downward. Hang a row of pineapple balloons across a room for a fantastic tropical effect.
